message.content: {"id": "49299", "title": "Bug 49299: Incorrect behavior with custom cookie name in Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1", "description": "The bug report states that in chapter 7.1.1 of Servlet 3.0, it is mentioned that a custom cookie name affects URL rewriting. However, the current behavior in the trunk does not follow this statement. The attached war file can reproduce this issue.", "OB": "The current behavior of the Servlet 3.0 implementation does not implement the functionality mentioned in chapter 7.1.1. The default 'jsessionid' cookie name is used instead of the custom cookie name.", "EB": "The expected result is that if the functionality mentioned in chapter 7.1.1 is implemented, the URL rewriting should include the custom cookie name. In the specific case of the attached war file, the expected URL for the Reload link would be 'http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F'.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 1. Deploy the attached war file named 'cookiename.war'. 2. Access 'http://localhost:8080/cookiename/'. "}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '49299', 'title': 'Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting', 'description': 'Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Expected result: if that phrase in 7.1.1 is to be followed, I would expect the Reload link to behttp://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F ', 'SR': '"That is not true for the current trunk: the default "jsessionid" is used instead.I am attaching a war file that reproduces this issue.Steps to reproduce:1. Deploy it as cookiename.war2. Access http://localhost:8080/cookiename/3. '}
